paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports on a monoallelic nonsense mutation in the BRCA2 gene among Sudanese women with breast cancer, detailing the variant, its clinical significance, and penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A heterozygous monoallelic nonsense mutation at nucleotide 3385 was found in four patients out of 9.
A heterozygous monoallelic nonsense mutation at nucleotide 3385 was found in four patients out of 9.

A heterozygous monoallelic nonsense mutation at nucleotide 3385 was found in four patients out of 9.

functional_data.summary: The mutation leads to a premature stop codon, resulting in a truncated protein.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation was found in affected individuals.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the need for further work to demonstrate the mutation's usefulness in screening for breast cancer.
key_quotes: A heterozygous monoallelic nonsense mutation at nucleotide 3385 was found in four patients out of 9.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
